general.q: Will LOUCA23 provide live broadcasts during the event?
general.a: Of course not! The event will only be held offline at FKIP UNS Surakarta. We 'may' provide video documentation, but we can't promise that.

general.q: Is LOUCA23 open to the public?
general.a: Yes, LOUCA23 is open to the public and all circles, both Open Source Software (OSS) activists, contributors, users, communities, and businesses in the Asian region. Several guests from outside Asia will also come to support this activity.

general.q: Does the committee provide lodging for the participants??
general.a: We do not provide lodging for the participants. However, local volunteers will provide several decent lodging recommendation options for you to choose later.

Call For Paper.q: Will there be accommodation, both travel and lodging expenses, for the speaker?
Call For Paper.a: 1. If you are already a TDF Member, you can submit a reimbursement to TDF (The Document Foundation)
2. If you already have an Ubuntu membership, you can also submit a reimbursement to the Ubuntu Community
3. If not from both, if the sponsors are sufficient, then there will be a reimbursement from the committee, but not 100%
